title: U S  stocks lower at close of trade  Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0 14
content:
Investing com   U S  stocks were lower after the close on Monday  as losses in the Oil   Gas  Utilities and Healthcare sectors led shares lower 
At the close in NYSE  the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0 14   while the S P 500 index fell 0 27   and the NASDAQ Composite index fell 0 04  
The best performers of the session on the Dow Jones Industrial Average were  Home Depot  Inc  NYSE HD   which rose 1 82  or 2 47 points to trade at 138 07 at the close  Meanwhile  Cisco Systems Inc  NASDAQ CSCO  added 0 56  or 0 17 points to end at 30 27 and  Visa Inc   NYSE V  was up 0 38  or 0 31 points to 82 15 in late trade 
The worst performers of the session were  General Electric  Company  NYSE GE   which fell 2 55  or 0 78 points to trade at 29 75 at the close  Merck   Company Inc  NYSE MRK  declined 1 15  or 0 72 points to end at 61 81 and  Exxon Mobil  Corporation  NYSE XOM  was down 1 07  or 0 92 points to 84 97 
The top performers on the S P 500 were CSX Corporation  NASDAQ CSX  which rose 3 74  to 45 99  CF Industries Holdings Inc  NYSE CF  which was up 3 07  to settle at 35 25 and Waters Corporation  NYSE WAT  which gained 2 71  to close at 145 28 
The worst performers were Qualcomm Incorporated  NASDAQ QCOM  which was down 12 72  to 54 88 in late trade  AutoZone Inc  NYSE AZO  which lost 3 98  to settle at 739 35 and  Transocean Ltd   NYSE RIG  which was down 3 59  to 14 76 at the close 
The top performers on the NASDAQ Composite were  Gordmans Stores  Inc  NASDAQ GMAN  which rose 14 34  to 0 855   ViewRay Inc   NASDAQ VRAY  which was up 18 33  to settle at 4 970 and  Marinus Pharma   NASDAQ MRNS  which gained 18 10  to close at 1 37 
The worst performers were DryShips Inc  NASDAQ DRYS  which was down 33 17  to 5 40 in late trade  KBS Fashion Group Ltd  NASDAQ KBSF  which lost 24 95  to settle at 0 2000 and  Aviat Networks  Inc  NASDAQ AVNW  which was down 23 33  to 10 3500 at the close 
Rising stocks outnumbered declining ones on the New York Stock Exchange by 1728 to 1492 and 45 ended unchanged  on the Nasdaq Stock Exchange  1531 fell and 989 advanced  while 104 ended unchanged 
Shares in CSX Corporation  NASDAQ CSX  rose to all time highs  up 3 74  or 1 66 to 45 99  Shares in DryShips Inc  NASDAQ DRYS  fell to 5 year lows  falling 33 17  or 2 68 to 5 40  
The CBOE Volatility Index  which measures the implied volatility of S P 500 options  was up 2 08  to 11 78 
Gold for February delivery was up 0 95  or 11 45 to  1216 35 a troy ounce  Elsewhere in commodities trading  Crude oil for delivery in March fell 0 62  or 0 33 to hit  52 89 a barrel  while the March Brent oil contract fell 0 23  or 0 13 to trade at  55 36 a barrel 
EUR USD was up 0 42  to 1 0748  while USD JPY fell 1 38  to 113 05 
The US Dollar Index was down 0 63  at 100 14

title: Motorola  MSI  Selects Aviat As Wireless Backhaul Provider
content: Motorola Solutions  Inc    NYSE MSI   recently announced that it has selected Aviat Networks  Inc    NASDAQ AVNW   as the wireless backhaul provider for the State of Florida s statewide mission critical P25 network  Through this strategic collaboration  Motorola aims to strengthen its leading position in the public safety domain Headquartered in Milpitas  CA  Aviat offers microwave networking solutions along with a comprehensive suite of localized professional and support services to provide seamless connectivity to federal clients and defense organizations  With more than seven decades of experience  the company s portfolio includes microwave routers and high power  high capacity radios that deliver unmatched network capacity and reliability Motorola aims to leverage this extensive product portfolio and Aviat s rich experience to build interoperable radio communications system for Florida s P25 network  The P25 project was initiated to address the need for common digital public safety radio communications standards for first responders and homeland security emergency response professionals  It ensures that two way radio communications are interoperable  so that public safety responders can achieve enhanced coordination  timely response and efficient and effective use of communications equipment As the leading provider of mission critical communication products and services for government and commercial customers alike  Motorola has been offering its services to police and security forces and optimizing their operations for years  In an effort to further expand its public safety measures  the company has launched new broadband service  high power mobile radio and mobile app solutions  dedicated to public security  The company s CommandCentral Aware software has helped achieve a significant drop in the crime rate With this software assistance  experts can track video footage  voice and other critical data simultaneously  It uses advanced analytics  accumulating computer aided dispatch system generated real time information  emergency alerts and information from other data sources to lend support to the first responders within seconds  It also helps crime analysts to confirm the exact location of the responding officers and facilitate transmission of critical data like camera footage  past criminal activity and other such significant statistics All these endeavors have not only helped check crime rates and optimize public service operations but have also driven the company s growth and consistent impressive performance Motorola has outperformed the  in the past year with an average return of 36 6  compared with 1 8  rise for the latter Motorola currently has a Zacks Rank  3  Hold   A couple of better ranked stocks in the industry are Comtech Telecommunications Corp    NASDAQ CMTL   and Ubiquiti Networks  Inc    NASDAQ UBNT    both sporting a Zacks Rank  1  Strong Buy   You can see  Comtech has long term earnings growth expectation of 5   It has trumped earnings estimates in each of the trailing four quarters  the average positive surprise being 136          Ubiquiti has long term earnings growth expectation of 14   It surpassed earnings estimates thrice in the trailing four quarters  the average positive surprise being 11 3  Will You Make a Fortune on the Shift to Electric Cars Here s another stock idea to consider  Much like petroleum 150 years ago  lithium power may soon shake the world  creating millionaires and reshaping geo politics  Soon electric vehicles  EVs  may be cheaper than gas guzzlers  Some are already reaching 265 miles on a single charge With battery prices plummeting and charging stations set to multiply  one company stands out as the  1 stock to buy according to Zacks research It s not the one you think

title: Aviat Networks names new CEO
content:
Aviat Networks  NASDAQ AVNW  appoints Peter Smith as president and CEO  effective today 
Interim CEO Stan Gallagher will remain with the company as COO and principal financing officer 
Smith most recently served as the SVP  US Windows and Canada for Jeld Wen
